summary: Build a Class 10 learning app covering all NCERT chapters, offering 20 learning modes and a Settings area with 30+ adjustable options.
known_issues: Learning modes are not accessible (cannot be opened/launched from the app UI).
Learning modes open but only show placeholder text ('This learning mode is ready for you...') instead of actual content/interactions.

existing_features.title: Create the core app information architecture for a Class 10 NCERT learning app, including: (a) a Home dashboard, (b) a Chapters area that organizes all Class 10 NCERT chapters by subject, (c) a Learning Modes area that exposes 20 distinct learning modes, and (d) an in-app Settings area accessible from primary navigation.

Include a complete Class 10 NCERT chapter catalog in the app UI, organized by subject with chapter titles and chapter numbering. At minimum, cover the common NCERT Class 10 subjects: Mathematics, Science, Social Science, English, and Hindi, with each subject listing its chapters as selectable items.

Implement 20 distinct learning modes and present them as a browsable list/grid. Each mode must have: name, short description, and a start action. Modes must be launchable from (a) the Learning Modes area and (b) from a Chapter detail page (pre-selecting that chapter).

Add an in-app Settings section containing 30+ adjustable settings options, grouped into logical categories (e.g., Learning, Practice/Quiz, Content Display, Accessibility, Notifications/Reminders (local-only), Privacy/Data). Settings must include a mix of toggles, dropdowns, and sliders, and must be editable by the user.

Define and apply one coherent, creative visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, components style) suitable for a Class 10 study app, and enforce it consistently across Home, Chapters, Learning Modes, and Settings screens.

Add basic offline-friendly behavior for the chapter catalog, learning modes list, and settings so the app remains usable after initial load (no external APIs required for core navigation and settings).

Fix the issue where Learning Modes are not accessible by ensuring that Learning Modes navigation and launching a mode works from all entry points (Primary navigation, Home quick-access card, Learning Modes list Start button, and Chapter Detail Start Learning buttons), and that the Learning Mode Run page renders without errors for every modeId in the predefined list.

Add two new subjects to the chapter catalog—“English Grammar” and “Hindi Vyakaran”—including a complete chapter/topic list for each subject, and make them fully usable anywhere the subject list appears (Chapters tabs/list, Chapter detail routing, and any chapter-driven learning mode launch).

Add an in-app purchase (IAP) option that allows users to upgrade to a Premium status within the app UI, including a clear Premium/Upgrade entry point in Settings and persistent storage of the user’s Premium status keyed by their Internet Identity principal.

Replace the placeholder content in the Learning Mode Run page so that opening any learning mode shows real, mode-specific learning content and at least one interactive element (not just the message 'This learning mode is ready for you...'). The experience must work for all 20 predefined modeIds in frontend/src/data/learningModes.ts.

When a chapter context is provided (via search params subject and chapterId), show chapter-tailored content for the selected learning mode; when chapter context is missing, keep the existing 'Choose a Chapter' call-to-action and ensure the mode UI clearly indicates that chapter selection is required for chapter-specific practice.

new_feature_requests.summary: Include all Class 10 NCERT chapters/content coverage in the app
Provide 20 distinct learning modes for studying/practice
Add an in-app Settings section with 30+ adjustable settings options
Add 2 more subjects with full NCERT chapters: English Grammar and Hindi Vyakaran
